contributors.headline: Project Manager at TNO-Integrated Vehicle Safety | Smart, Autonomous and Connected Vehicles Research

projects.title: Study of Fluid Flow in Automotive HVAC Ducts and Vents
projects.description:
- Developed advanced Large Eddy Simulation (LES) and Detached Eddy Simulation (DES) based Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) approaches to analyze the flow of air through the HVAC ducts and vents systems.
- New models yielded an improvement of 10% in the accuracy of the simulations.
- Also designed, proposed and tested a new experimental setup for rapid testing of the HVAC system.

contributors.headline: Project Manager at TNO-Integrated Vehicle Safety | Smart, Autonomous and Connected Vehicles Research

projects.title: Development of a Software to Autonomously Pilot a Fleet of Drones
projects.description:
- Worked in collaboration with Leonardo, Italy, as a part of a multi-disciplinary team composed of engineers and architects
- This software provides an easy to use interface to add an area to be covered and can then find the optimal distribution and path plan to maximize coverage and minimize battery and time spent

contributors.headline: Project Manager at TNO-Integrated Vehicle Safety | Smart, Autonomous and Connected Vehicles Research

projects.title: Simulation and Analysis of Abrasive Mass Finishing Processes using Computational Fluid Dynamics Techniques
projects.description:
- Worked with the Institute of High Performance Computing, Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR), Singapore to develop low-cost computational models to simulate and analyse abrasive mass finishing techniques using open-source tools
- Worked extensively on developing unconventional Lagrangian Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) based computational models
- Also conducted experimental evaluation and developed Finite Volume Method (FVM) based models to validate the new SPH based technique
- Part of research accepted for the International Conference on Computational Methods (ICCM) 2019, Singapore
- Part of research published in the International Journal of Advanced Manufacturing Technology (May 2020)

projects.title: Solar Thermo-regulated Jacket
projects.description:
- Project co-sponsored by Texas Instruments and Department of Science and Technology, Government of India
- Worked as the Technical Lead for the team, which designed and fabricated a thermo-regulating solar jacket based on the Peltier effect, capable of cooling the user by up to 15 degrees in 10 minutes
- Conducted numerical and computational analyses for the design
- Also prototyped the concept using an umbrella as a proof of concept
- Project qualified for the Semi-Finals stage of the India Innovation Challenge Design Contest, 2018
- Research paper presented at the IEEE International Conference on Computing Power and Communications Technologies, September 2019.

profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
The TNO trainee program is a highly selective two-year program (with just 12 people selected every year), with the aim of creating connections across the organization, and developing the selected trainees for taking on leadership positions within the organization. Doing so, the trainees develop a broad and diverse skillset and large network, which enables them to think beyond the departmental boundaries, and act as facilitators of the innovation process.

The trainees undertake three rotations of 8 months in different departments and roles, as mutually agreed upon by the trainees and the managers. During each stint of 8 months, the trainees work, on an average, for 70% of their time for the chosen department. Another 10% of their time is spent on trainee projects, which are TNO-wide strategic problems. Finally, the remaining 20% of their time is spent on personal and leadership development, through workshops, peer-based counselling, professional coaching, and networking sessions.

TRAINEE PROJECTS UNDERTAKEN:
- Impact First: Worked with a team to conduct several interviews with SMEs and the government. Worked to define a set of metrics to quantify the impact that TNO has in the world of SMEs.
- Bring Sustainability Home: Worked with a team to suggest ways in which TNO can facilitate its employees to become more sustainable.
- New Ways of Recruitment: Led a team to independently evaluate TNO's ability to attract and recruit juniors and finding new ways to attract promising talent in an increasingly competitive talent market.
profile_positions.title: Trainee - Scientist Innovator

profile_positions.description:
Department: VoltaChem - Roadmap Sustainable Chemical Industry

VoltaChem is a shared research program of TNO that works on break-through technologies for accelerating the electrification of the chemical industry. This includes development and scaling up of technologies for hydrogen production and CO2 conversion. 

My tasks primarily involved supporting the business development and marketing and communications activities for the program, including, but not limited to:
- Supported the development of the proposal documents for the GroenvermogenNL and MOOI calls, as a part of the Nationale Groeifonds (Ronde 1 and 2).
- Organized and hosted a webinar on the materials challenge for hydrogen production. The webinar was selected as an official side event of the European Hydrogen Week 2022 (an undertaking of the Clean Hydrogen Partnership - EU) and saw the attendance of over 80 participants from around the world.
- Managed the social media presence for 4 months.
- Defined a marketing strategy for the program.
- Visiting fairs and conferences.

Also worked (in an independent capacity) on co-developing FutureCarbonNL- a proposed 8-year long program, supported by the Ministry of EZK and several leading industries and universities in the Netherlands, for the development of technology for CO2 utilization. my tasks involved:
- Organized the bottom-up collection of input from large companies, SMEs and start-ups.
- Co-conducted an analysis of the internationalization potential of CCU technologies for the Netherlands, also through direct solicitation with innovation attachés of the Netherlands.
- Co-conducted an analysis of the stakeholders involved and engagement strategies.
- Co-organized an online information session, attended by 90 representatives of various companies, start-ups, SMEs, and knowledge institutes.
profile_positions.title: Business Developer - Sustainable Chemical Industry

profile_positions.description:
Department: Sustainable Transport and Logistics (Unit Traffic and Transport)

- Co-created a techno-economic projection model for the fleet uptake of heavy-duty road-based transport for the years 2022-50, for the Netherlands. Also used to generate policy and infrastructure advice for stakeholders.
- Worked on data analysis for the hydrogen internal combustion engine research facility.
- Conducted a valorization study for a new innovative in-house technology.
- Co-designed kick-offs and teams for two major internal projects.
- Co-organized the pilot tests for examining the impact of behaviour on non-exhaust emissions for a European project.
profile_positions.title: Consultant - Sustainable Mobility

profile_positions.description:
- Worked with the Climate Comfort team to study the fluid flow through automotive HVAC ducts and vents.
- Developed advanced Large Eddy Simulation (LES) and Detached Eddy Simulation (DES) based Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) approaches to analyze the flow of air through the HVAC ducts and vents systems.
- New models yielded an improvement of 10% in the accuracy of the simulations.
- Also designed, proposed and tested a new experimental setup for rapid testing of the HVAC system.

profile_positions.title: Automotive Journalism Intern

profile_positions.description:
- Worked with the Engineering Department to design, optimize and program a fully automated production line for the KTM RC 390 using Siemens NX, Siemens Technomatix and ABB RobotStudio
- Also worked on DFMEA applications for redesigning the catalytic converter housing of the KTM Duke 200 for better manufacturability and weldability

profile_positions.title: Process Technology Intern

volunteer_experiences.description:
- Directly oversaw a team of over 200 club representatives and volunteers.
- Successfully coordinated the organization of 14 events with over 600 participants in the three-day-long annual techno-cultural sports fest of Shiv Nadar University.

- Oversaw the functioning of 14 technical societies on campus.
- Drafted and vetted a new Technical Affairs Constitution.
- Facilitated the opening of 4 new technical societies during the tenure.
- Liaisoned with the university administration on multiple student issues.
- Organized 4 competitions and workshops during the tenure, with an average participation of over 50 students each.
